item.title: Zelda Voice Actress Discusses Creative Direction in Audition
item.content:encoded:
The voice behind Princess Zelda discusses the direction and expectations, or lackthereof, she was given during her audition.

Patricia Summersett has been the English voice of Princess Zelda since the release of The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild in 2017. Now, she‚Äôs opening up about the audition process, the direction she was given by Nintendo, and more.

Summersett Was Given ‚ÄòBleached Script‚Äô Ahead of Casting

In an interview with IGN, Patricia Summersett explained that she was given a bleached script when first auditioning for the role. This means that she was given limited information about the role she was auditioning for and didn‚Äôt actually know she was attempting to provide the voice for one of gaming‚Äôs most iconic characters.

Summersett was given the description of Zelda as a younger teenage princess who is wise beyond her years. She was also told that the character had the weight of the world thrust upon her.

‚ÄúThose were key things I‚Äôd gone into when I looked at the script, when I started to play around with my voice and decide what to do for that particular character,‚Äù she said.

Additionally, Summersett reveals that she‚Äôd also tried out for other roles in the game, one of which ended up being Urbosa.

Summersett Views Her Zelda Accent As Hylian

As for Zelda having a British accent, Summersett revealed that it was not a note from Nintendo. Rather, it was a choice she made on her own.

‚ÄúI schooled in London and so I thought something that sounds a little bit RP would make it heightened and put it into that kind of class system I was imagining for royalty. So I did that,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a little more comfortable to say this is a Hylian accent versus just a particular version of a UK accent.‚Äù

Link and Zelda are coming to the big screen for the first time ever in 2027. Check out the latest on the Legend of Zelda movie at this link.

item.title: NVIDIA Warns of Tight Memory Supply for Coming Quarters
item.content:encoded:
NVIDIA‚Äôs CFO sets the stage for uncertainty about the company‚Äôs ability to grow in the gaming sector amid current memory shortages.

Currently, NVIDIA is reporting record growth following its Q4 earnings for fiscal year 2026. However, as the company moves toward a heavy focus on AI and data centers, rather than relying on gaming for the majority of its revenue, the question has been raised about whether it will continue to grow year over year in the forthcoming fiscal year.

NVIDIA CFO Cautions Investors on Gaming Growth Uncertainty

During an investor call following the release of their quarterly earnings, NVIDIA CFO Colette Kress was asked directly if she foresees a continued pattern of year-over-year growth in the next fiscal year.

In response, she said that, as much as the company would love to have an additional supply of memory, they expect things to be tight for the next ‚Äúcouple of quarters.‚Äù Therefore, it‚Äôs still too early to tell.

‚ÄúWe do believe for a couple of quarters, it is going to be very tight. If things improve by the end of the year, there is an opportunity to think about what that is from a year-over-year growth [angle], but it‚Äôs still too early for us to know at this time, and we‚Äôll get back to you as soon as we can,‚Äù she said.

NVIDIA Is Skipping Graphics Card Releases to Focus on AI

It was recently reported that NVIDIA was opting not to release new graphics cards this year. This isn‚Äôt a concerted effort to focus on AI chips and datacenters due to the RAM shortage. Additionally, the company plans on cutting production of the current RTX 50-series graphics cards due to the shortage. Learn more about that here.

Learn more about how the financial growth of NVIDIA has shifted from reliance on gaming to reliance on AI and data centers at this link.

item.title: NVIDIA Records Record Quarterly Growth, up 73% in Last Year
item.content:encoded:
NVIDIA reports unprecedented growth in its financial results for Q4 of the fiscal year 2026.

On February 25, NVIDIA announced its quarterly earnings for the quarter, which ended one month earlier. The company recorded revenue of $68.1 billion, up 20% from the previous quarter and 73% from this time last year. Also, total revenue for the fiscal year was $215.9 billion. That is a 65% increase from the prior year.

Data Center Growth Skyrockets for NVIDIA

As the AI boom continues to take shape, NVIDIA‚Äôs Q4 data center revenue was a record-setting $62.3 billion, up 22% from the previous quarter and 75% from last year. Their report attributes this growth to major platform shifts, specifically accelerated Computing and AI. Full-year data center revenue rose 68% to a record $193.7 billion.

Gaming Revenue Grows for NVIDIA

As for gaming revenue, Q4 saw a 47% year-over-year increase. Total gaming revenue for the quarter with $3.7 billion. However, while there was year-over-year growth, gaming and aipc revenue are actually down 13% from the previous quarter. That decrease is attributed to inventory naturally moderating following a season of strong holiday demand.

Jonathan Hobbs of IncomeShares noted that back in 2020, gaming was the largest revenue driver for NVIDIA. However, data centers now account for 90% of NVIDIA‚Äôs revenue, signaling the concentrated shift to AI.

The AI boom, leading to a RAM shortage, continues to loom over the future of gaming. Currently, it is expected that gamers may not see the PlayStation 6 until 2029. Even Microsoft does not want to commit to a 2027 launch window for its next console.

item.title: Marathon‚Äôs Server Slam Didn‚Äôt Gain Traction This Weekend, But It Still Topped Some Titans
item.content:encoded:
Marathon‚Äôs server slam started on Thursday, and within a couple of hours, hundreds of thousands of people had either downloaded it and started playing or started watching it on a streaming platform somewhere. It picked up pace, hit more than 143,000 concurrent players on Steam alone, and then promptly fizzled.

Within six hours, the peak dropped by 30,000 players, and by the following evening, it was peaking at half the original high. Many believed the weekend would yield some gains as players worldwide came off work and into Bungie‚Äôs Marathon, but it wasn‚Äôt to be. That being said, the server slam still managed to top some titans on Steam.

Marathon Could Go Either Way

Marathon didn‚Äôt make immense waves in the gaming space this weekend, but it still beat the likes of Battlefield 6 and Call of Duty.

It‚Äôs no big secret that these two titanic franchises have had their fair share of issues in the last few months. Black Ops 7 launched to a woeful reception and is suffering immensely at the hands of a disinterested community. On the other hand, Battlefield 6 continues to flounder amidst poor updates and a slow change cadence.

Marathon will be the ‚Äònew shiny thing‚Äô this month when it launches on March 5, marking Bungie‚Äôs long-awaited entry into the extraction shooter space. It‚Äôs going up against some monumental competition, especially in the form of both ARC Raiders and Escape from Tarkov, but tens of thousands of people have already gotten a taste of Marathon and (likely) want more.

At the time of writing, Marathon‚Äôs server slam product had a 24-hour peak player count of 76,437 users on Steam. This is how that stacks up against other, similar games on the platform:

  • ARC Raiders ‚Äì 227,765
  • Apex Legends ‚Äì 201,571
  • Marathon ‚Äì 76,437
  • Battlefield 6 ‚Äì 71,861
  • Call of Duty ‚Äì 52,575
  • Escape from Tarkov ‚Äì 19,220
  • Destiny 2 ‚Äì 11,623

The discourse around Marathon has been pretty mixed. There‚Äôs enough positivity there for the game to enjoy a semi-decent launch, but only if Bungie can deliver a strong roadmap and rapid enough updates. The team has already been addressing the game‚Äôs biggest gripes, including concerns around the complex UI, the lack of PvP, and optimization issues on PC platforms.

Unfortunately, Marathon is also going to be a game that lives or dies by its viewership, such is the life of extraction games. If the creators can get hooked, they‚Äôll retain an audience and keep feeding people into the game, but if that doesn‚Äôt happen, Marathon will surely plummet.

In the opening hours of the server slam, Marathon secured a peak of around 301,000 viewers on Twitch, and then, thanks to a huge push from popular streamers, it edged past that to hit 350,000 on Sunday, March 1. That was short-lived, though. The peak came at around 7 PM GMT, and by 10 PM GMT, only 70,000 people were watching the game.

It should be stressed that this isn‚Äôt a negative take of Marathon‚Äôs performance, as such. This is a game that could offer a sorely needed shake-up to the extraction genre, in a way that ARC Raiders managed to do in October 2025. It‚Äôs unique enough to leave a mark on the space, but the longevity of the thing is yet to be witnessed.

item.title: Today‚Äôs Wordle #1717: Hints and Answer for March 2, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you‚Äôre a beginner or a daily player, today‚Äôs tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak‚Äîif you‚Äôre open to a little extra help. So, if you‚Äôve found yourself stuck with today‚Äôs Wordle, don‚Äôt worry, below you‚Äôll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1717 for March 2, 2026

To play today‚Äôs Wordle, head to the game‚Äôs website. If you want to go right to today‚Äôs answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today‚Äôs and yesterday‚Äôs editions of Wordle. If you don‚Äôt want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There is currently no app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, March 2, 2026

The Wordle answer for game #1717 isn‚Äôt too challenging. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today‚Äôs answer takes an average of 3.8 out of 6 guesses. That makes it slightly easier than the 4.3-guess average from March 1.

General Wordle Hints For March 2

Without giving today‚Äôs Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: This word is often associated with texture rather than appearance.
  • Hint 2: It‚Äôs commonly used when something is unpleasant to touch.
  • Hint 3: The term shows up more in casual descriptions than formal writing.
  • Hint 4: You‚Äôre more likely to encounter it when describing a mess or residue than something clean.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1712 for March 2, 2026.

Starter Words For March 2, 2026

If you want help getting started without having today‚Äôs Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • LUCKY

  • BULKY

Today‚Äôs Wordle Answer For Game #1717 On March 2, 2026

If you‚Äôve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today‚Äôs Wordle below.

Answer: SLIME

If you solved today‚Äôs Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow‚Äôs puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

What Does Today‚Äôs Wordle Answer Mean?

SLIME can be both a noun and a verb. As a noun, it means a ‚Äúthin, glutinous mud.‚Äù As a verb, it means ‚Äúto cover or smear with or as if with slime.‚Äù

Yesterday‚Äôs Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here‚Äôs yesterday‚Äôs Wordle answer for Game #1716 on March 1, 2026

Answer: FLUKE

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #1717?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on March 3 will be Wordle Game #1718.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn‚Äôt fully released until 2021. The game challenges players to guess a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.

item.title: SAROS Dev Housemarque Staffing up for Next Project
item.content:encoded:
Housemarque currently has multiple job openings. They are gearing up for their next project.

Housemarque is the maker of Returnal and the upcoming PlayStation 5 exclusive, SAROS. While the latter has yet to be released, new job listings on the company‚Äôs official website show what they are looking for in their next project.

Details on Housemarque Job Listings

There are currently six openings at the company, one of which is for the Principal Graphics Programmer. The job listing notes that they will work closely with the team, specifically the Technical Art Director, Technical Director, and Graphics Architect, to help drive the next evolution of games at the studio.

‚ÄúTogether with the team, you will push innovation in ray tracing, lighting, and shading, turning fresh ideas into practical solutions, whether through GPGPU techniques or real-time ML and tensor computing,‚Äù the listing notes.

Additionally, they are looking for someone with 8+ years of experience in graphics programming for similar projects, including at least one shipped AAA video game. Notably, they are also requesting a candidate specifically passionate about pushing Fidelity on PlayStation hardware.

Lead Gameplay Animator Listing Specifically for Upcoming Game

They‚Äôre also looking for a lead gameplay animator. This listing specifically notes that they are working on the ‚Äúnext groundbreaking title‚Äù from the team. Potential candidates should have a background in gameplay animation for AAA games, preferably in a leadership position.

‚ÄúIf you‚Äôre a seasoned gameplay animation leader with a passion for developing both ideas and people, you‚Äôll thrive in our collaborative environment. While we appreciate self-starters who are eager to learn new techniques, we also value team players who can contribute to a larger vision,‚Äù the listing reads.

All positions are local to Helsinki, Finland. Those interested can learn more here.
